metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4553 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Drupal 7.x before 7.16 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information and possibly re-install Drupal and execute arbitrary PHP code via an external database server, related to "transient conditions."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

drupal7 - 7.14-1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> mitigated if webserver user cannot write to drupal code or data though information leak through install.php is also possible

criterions.comment: drupal7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.14-1.1').
